name: Abyssal Specter
oracle_text: Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.

name: Advance Scout
oracle_text: First strike
{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"The soldier's path is worn smooth by the tread of many feet—all in one direction, none returning."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Air Elemental
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.

name: Angelic Page
oracle_text: Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: If only every message were as perfect as its bearer.

name: Arc Lightning
oracle_text: Arc Lightning deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three targets.
flavor_text: Rainclouds don't last long in Shiv, but that doesn't stop the lightning.

rulings.text: You choose how many targets Arc Lightning has and how the damage is divided as you cast the spell. Each target must receive at least 1 damage.

If some of the creatures are illegal targets as Arc Lightning tries to resolve, the original division of damage still applies but no damage is dealt to the illegal targets. If all targets are illegal, Arc Lightning doesn’t resolve.

name: Argothian Elder
oracle_text: {T}: Untap two target lands.
flavor_text:
Sharpen your ears
—Elvish expression meaning
"grow wiser"

rulings.text: The ability can target an already untapped land.
The ability must target two different lands. It can’t be activated if there is just one land to target.

name: Armored Pegasus
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text:
"I always charge a little extra to take on a pegasus. They fly like eagles, kick like mules, and hide like hermits."
—Tahlil en-Dal, bounty hunter

name: Azure Drake
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text:
Little dreamt could seem so cruel
As waiting for the wings outspread,
The jagged teeth, the burning eyes,
And dagger-claws that clench to nerves.

name: Blinking Spirit
oracle_text: {0}: Return Blinking Spirit to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"Don't look at it Maybe it'll go away"
—Ib Halfheart, goblin tactician

name: Broken Fall
oracle_text: Return Broken Fall to its owner's hand: Regenerate target creature.
flavor_text:
"I think I used up all my good luck and all my bad luck in the same fall."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Cackling Fiend
oracle_text: When Cackling Fiend enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card.
flavor_text: Its windpipe is only the first to amplify its maddening laughter.

rulings.text: If the opponent has no cards in hand, this has no effect.

name: Catastrophe
oracle_text: Destroy all lands or all creatures. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
flavor_text: Radiant's eyes flashed. "Go, then," the angel spat at Serra, "and leave this world to those who truly care."

rulings.text: You choose land or creatures when the spell resolves.

name: Cinder Marsh
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {B} or {R}. Cinder Marsh doesn't untap during your next untap step.

name: Control Magic
oracle_text: Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

rulings.text: Gaining control of a creature doesn’t cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

name: Counterspell
oracle_text: Counter target spell.

name: Crazed Skirge
oracle_text: Flying, haste
flavor_text: They are Phyrexia's couriers; the messages they carry are inscribed on their slick hides.

name: Curfew
oracle_text: Each player returns a creature they control to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: ". . . But I'm not tired"

name: Dark Ritual
oracle_text: Add {B}{B}{B}.

name: Dirtcowl Wurm
oracle_text: Whenever an opponent plays a land, put a +1/+1 counter on Dirtcowl Wurm.
flavor_text: Few of Rath's rivers follow a steady course, so many new channels are carved for them.

rulings.text: A spell or ability that tells a player to “put a land onto the battlefield” does not count as playing a land.

name: Disenchant
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
flavor_text:
"I implore you not to forget the horrors of the past. You would have us start the Brothers' War anew"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

name: Disruptive Student
oracle_text: {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
flavor_text:
"Teferi is a problem student. Always late for class. No appreciation for constructive use of time."
—Barrin, progress report

name: Drifting Meadow
oracle_text: Drifting Meadow enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

name: Elvish Lyrist
oracle_text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.

name: Exhume
oracle_text: Each player puts a creature card from their graveyard onto the battlefield.
flavor_text:
"Death—an outmoded concept. We sleep, and we change."
—Sitrik, birth priest

name: Fecundity
oracle_text: Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller may draw a card.
flavor_text: Life is eternal. A lifetime is ephemeral.

rulings.text: In a multiplayer game, if a player loses the game, triggered abilities that player controls are removed from the stack and no more from that player can be added. This means that if a creature an opponent controls dies while you control Fecundity, and you lose the game before Fecundity’s triggered ability resolves (perhaps because you lost the game at the same time that the creature died), that player won’t draw a card.

name: Fertile Ground
oracle_text: Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional one mana of any color.
flavor_text: The forest was too lush for the brothers to despoil—almost.

name: Fire Ants
oracle_text: {T}: Fire Ants deals 1 damage to each other creature without flying.
flavor_text: Visitors to Shiv fear the dragons, the goblins, or the viashino. Natives fear the ants.

name: Flood
oracle_text: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.
flavor_text:
"A dash of cool water does wonders to clear a cluttered battlefield."
—Vibekke Ragnild, Witches and War

name: Giant Growth
oracle_text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

name: Gorilla Warrior
flavor_text: They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.

name: Healing Salve
oracle_text: Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

name: Heat Ray
oracle_text: Heat Ray deals X damage to target creature.
flavor_text: It's not known whether the Thran built the device to forge their wonders or to defend them.

name: Hurricane
oracle_text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

name: Infantry Veteran
oracle_text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war."
—Telim'Tor

rulings.text: An “attacking creature” is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

name: Land Tax
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You can fetch any of the “Snow-Covered” lands, since they all also have the supertype basic.

This ability has an “intervening ‘if’ clause.” That means (1) the ability won’t trigger at all unless any one of your opponents controls more lands than you, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you control at least as many lands as each of your opponents by the time it resolves.
You shuffle your library if you search, even if you don’t put any basic land cards into your hand.

name: Lhurgoyf
oracle_text: Lhurgoyf's power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.
flavor_text:
"Ach Hans, run It's the lhurgoyf"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

name: Lightning Elemental
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor_text: A lightning elemental once killed an entire tribe of merfolk—simply by going for a swim.

name: Living Death
oracle_text: Each player exiles all creature cards from their graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures they control, then puts all cards they exiled this way onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: As Living Death resolves, all players exile their creature cards from graveyards at the same time. Then all players sacrifice all creatures they control at the same time. Then all players put all creatures they exiled onto the battlefield at the same time.

Only cards exiled by Living Death’s first instruction are put onto the battlefield. If a replacement effect (such as that of Leyline of the Void) causes any of the sacrificed creatures to be exiled instead of put into a graveyard, those cards aren’t returned to the battlefield.

name: Llanowar Elves
oracle_text: {T}: Add {G}.
flavor_text:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

name: Mana Leak
oracle_text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
flavor_text:
"The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy."
—Volrath

name: Maniacal Rage
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.
flavor_text: Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.

name: Man-o'-War
oracle_text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Man-o’-War enters the battlefield, its ability must target itself.

name: Manta Riders
oracle_text: {U}: Manta Riders gains flying until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Water is firmament to the finned."
—Oracle en-Vec

name: Master Decoy
oracle_text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
flavor_text:
"A skilled decoy can throw your enemies off your trail. A master decoy can survive to do it again."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Mogg Hollows
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {R} or {G}. Mogg Hollows doesn't untap during your next untap step.

name: Nekrataal
oracle_text: First strike
When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.
flavor_text:
"I have seen the horrors Kaervek has freed. My Betrayal is certain—but of Kaervek or of Jamuraa, I cannot say."
—Jolrael

rulings.text: Nothing happens if there are no nonartifact, nonblack creatures on the battlefield when Nekrataal enters the battlefield, but if there is one, you must target it, even if it’s a creature you control.

name: Opportunity
oracle_text: Target player draws four cards.
flavor_text:
"He cocooned himself alone in his workshop for months. When he finally emerged, all broad grins and excited chatter, I knew he'd found his answer."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Pacifism
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
flavor_text: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

name: Pestilence
oracle_text: At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.
{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.
Note that “until end of turn” effects wear off after “at the beginning of the end step” triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.

name: Phyrexian Ghoul
oracle_text: Sacrifice a creature: Phyrexian Ghoul gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Phyrexia wastes nothing. Its food chain is a spiraling cycle.

name: Pincher Beetles
oracle_text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor_text:
"No fair Since when does a bug get ta munch on me?"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

name: Plated Rootwalla
oracle_text: {2}{G}: Plated Rootwalla gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
flavor_text:
" . . . And the third little boar built his house out of rootwalla plates . . . ."
—Skyshroud children's story

rulings.text: If this card’s ability is activated by one player, then another player takes control of it on the same turn, the second player can’t activate its ability that turn.

name: Polluted Mire
oracle_text: Polluted Mire enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

name: Prodigal Sorcerer
oracle_text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor_text: Occasionally members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

name: Raging Goblin
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor_text: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

name: Ray of Command
oracle_text: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.
flavor_text: "Heel."

rulings.text: You may target an untapped creature with Ray of Command.

The creature returns to the opponent when the “until end of turn” effect wears off during the cleanup step. It taps during the Cleanup step (if it is not already tapped), so any abilities triggered off it tapping happen at that time.
You tap the creature when you lose control of it for any reason — because Ray of Command’s effect ends, or because a spell or ability causes another player to gain control of it.

name: Reanimate
oracle_text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.
flavor_text:
"You will learn to earn death."
—Volrath

rulings.text: If a card in a player’s graveyard has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.
The amount of life you lose is determined by the converted mana cost of the card in your graveyard, not the creature once it’s on the battlefield.
You lose life after the creature is already on the battlefield. Any abilities it has that interact with loss of life, such as that of Platinum Emperion, apply to that loss of life.
If any abilities trigger on the creature entering the battlefield, those abilities resolve after you lose life. If losing life results in you losing the game, those abilities won’t resolve.
In a multiplayer game, if a player leaves the game, all cards that player owns leave as well. If you leave the game, the creature you control from Reanimate is exiled.

name: Remote Isle
oracle_text: Remote Isle enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

name: River Boa
oracle_text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.
flavor_text:
"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, Tales

name: Rolling Thunder
oracle_text: Rolling Thunder deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.
flavor_text: "Such rage," thought Vhati, gazing up at the thunderhead from the Predator. "It is Greven's mind manifest."

rulings.text: If X is 0, you can’t choose any targets.
You choose how many targets Rolling Thunder has and how the damage is divided as you cast the spell. Each target must receive at least 1 damage.

If some, but not all, of the targets become illegal by the time Rolling Thunder tries to resolve, the original division of damage still applies, but no damage is dealt to illegal targets. If all the targets are illegal, the spell won’t resolve.
If Rolling Thunder is copied, the copy will retain the original damage divsion. The spell or ability will likely allow you to choose new targets, but you can’t change the way damage is divided.

name: Sadistic Glee
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
flavor_text:
"First blood isn't as important as last blood."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Sanctum Custodian
oracle_text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
flavor_text: Serra told them to guard Urza as he healed. Five years they stood.

name: Sanctum Guardian
oracle_text: Sacrifice Sanctum Guardian: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to any target this turn, prevent that damage.
flavor_text: "Protect our mother in her womb."

name: Sandstorm
oracle_text: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
flavor_text: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.

name: Scaled Wurm
flavor_text:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

name: Scryb Sprites
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

name: Seasoned Marshal
oracle_text: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
flavor_text: There are only two rules of tactics: never be without a plan, and never rely on it.

rulings.text: Can target an already tapped creature if you want.

name: Seeker of Skybreak
oracle_text: {T}: Untap target creature.
flavor_text:
"We shun them not for their dream but for their refusal to let such a noble dream die a noble death."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

rulings.text: It can use its tap ability to untap itself.

name: Sengir Vampire
oracle_text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger. It doesn’t matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

name: Sewer Rats
oracle_text: {B}, Pay 1 life: Sewer Rats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than three times each turn.
flavor_text:
You lie down with rats, and the rats run away.
—Suq'Ata insult

name: Shower of Sparks
oracle_text: Shower of Sparks deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
flavor_text: The viashino had learned how to operate the rig through trial and error—mostly error.

rulings.text: If the creature leaves the battlefield before this resolves, it still damages the player.

name: Skyshroud Elite
oracle_text: Skyshroud Elite gets +1/+2 as long as an opponent controls a nonbasic land.
flavor_text:
"Civilization is a conspiracy to disguise the mutilation of nature."
—Skyshroud elite creed

name: Slippery Karst
oracle_text: Slippery Karst enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

name: Soltari Foot Soldier
oracle_text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
flavor_text:
"Children of the Ruins, raised to be warriors, know that life begins when another speaks their names."
—Soltari Tales of Life

name: Songstitcher
oracle_text: {1}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by target attacking creature with flying.
flavor_text: The true names of birds are songs woven into their souls.

name: Soul Warden
oracle_text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
flavor_text:
Count carefully the souls and see that none are lost.
—Vec teaching

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering the battlefield at the same time will each cause the other’s ability to trigger.
The life gain is mandatory.

name: Spike Colony
oracle_text: Spike Colony enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Colony: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

name: Spike Feeder
oracle_text: Spike Feeder enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Feeder: You gain 2 life.

name: Spike Weaver
oracle_text: Spike Weaver enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Weaver: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Weaver: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

rulings.text: The second ability includes your own creatures as well.

name: Spike Worker
oracle_text: Spike Worker enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Worker: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

name: Steam Blast
oracle_text: Steam Blast deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor_text: The viashino knew of the cracked pipes but deliberately left them unmended to bolster the rig's defenses.

name: Subversion
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 1 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
flavor_text: Kerrick's corrupt domain swelled like a blister on Tolaria's skin.

rulings.text: This is loss of life, not damage. It can’t be prevented.

name: Sun Clasp
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"And darkness shall be cast from me
For my soul resides in the Sun."
—Femeref dirge

name: Swords to Plowshares
oracle_text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

rulings.text: The amount of life gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.
If the creature’s power is negative, its controller doesn’t lose or gain life.

name: Symbiosis
oracle_text: Two target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text: Although the elves of Argoth always considered them a nuisance, the pixies made fine allies during the war against the machines.

name: Syphon Soul
oracle_text: Syphon Soul deals 2 damage to each other player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

name: Terror
oracle_text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

name: Thalakos Lowlands
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}. Thalakos Lowlands doesn't untap during your next untap step.

name: Tranquility
oracle_text: Destroy all enchantments.

name: Trumpeting Armodon
oracle_text: {1}{G}: Target creature blocks Trumpeting Armodon this turn if able.
flavor_text: These are its last days. But it will not go quietly.

name: Unnerve
oracle_text: Each opponent discards two cards.
flavor_text:
"If fear is the only tool you have left, then you'll never control me."
—Xantcha, to Gix

rulings.text: Players with less than 2 cards discard all they have.

name: Uthden Troll
oracle_text: {R}: Regenerate Uthden Troll.
flavor_text:
"Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere,
Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near,
Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh
'n da hurt'll disappear."
—Troll chant

name: Vec Townships
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {G} or {W}. Vec Townships doesn't untap during your next untap step.

name: Village Elder
oracle_text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate target creature.

name: Wall of Heat
oracle_text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor_text: At a distance, we mistook the sound for a waterfall . . . .

name: Weakness
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.

name: Wildfire Emissary
oracle_text: Protection from white
{1}{R}: Wildfire Emissary gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"The efreet is a striding storm with a voice that crackles like fire."
—Qhattib, vizier of Amiqat

name: Wind Drake
oracle_text: Flying
flavor_text:
"No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings."
—William Blake,
The Marriage of Heaven and Hell

name: Windfall
oracle_text: Each player discards their hand, then draws cards equal to the greatest number of cards a player discarded this way.
flavor_text:
"To fill your mind with knowledge, we must start by emptying it."
—Barrin, master wizard

name: Wrath of God
oracle_text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
